**Descriptive Statistics**

```{r}
summary1<-summary(dataset)
summary1
```

#load ggplot library
```{r warning=FALSE}
library("ggplot2")
```


How Sales are Distributed according to the age ranges (Also considering gender)

```{r warning=FALSE}
sales_in_gender<- ggplot(dataset,aes(x=Age,fill = Gender))+geom_histogram(binwidth = 2, position = "stack", color = "black", alpha = 0.7) + labs(title = "Age Distribution", x = "Age", y = "Frequency")
sales_in_gender
```

```{r warning=FALSE}
table1 <- table(dataset$Item.Purchased)
table1
```
Cloth Sizes distributed according to gender

```{r warning=FALSE}
plot1<- ggplot(dataset, aes(x=Size,fill=Gender))+geom_bar()
plot1
```
Purchasing according to the color

```{r warning=FALSE}
plot2<- ggplot(dataset,aes(x=Color,y=Purchase.Amount..USD.,fill=Color))+geom_boxplot()
plot2
```

Analyze the average age of customers and how it varies by location

```{r warning=FALSE}
table2<- aggregate(Age ~ Location, data = dataset, FUN = mean)
table2

```

```{r warning=FALSE}
plot3<- ggplot(table2,aes(x=Location,y=Age,color=Location))+ geom_point()
plot3
```


Analyze the average age of customers and how it varies by gender

```{r warning=FALSE}
table3<- aggregate(Age ~ Gender, data = dataset, FUN = mean) 
table3
```

Calculate the average rating and see how it varies by category.

```{r warning=FALSE}
table4<- aggregate(Review.Rating~Category, data = dataset, FUN = mean)
table4
```



**Correlation Analysis**

#install packages

```{r warning=FALSE}
install.packages("dplyr")

```
```{r}
library(dplyr)
```


```{r warning=FALSE}
numeric_data <- dataset[sapply(dataset, is.numeric)]
head(numeric_data)

```

```{r warning=FALSE}
correlation_matrix <- cor(numeric_data)
correlation_matrix

```

```{r warning=FALSE}
corrplot(correlation_matrix, method = "color", type = "upper", 
         tl.col = "black", tl.srt = 45, addCoef.col = "black")

```
